Content: I'd much rather put money into XMR than ZEC. Seems ZEC team would be much easier to subvert by an intelligence agency than XMR's "team"

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Would you not need a direct connection to EVERY node to shut them down though?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: because a node would shutdown and stop propagating the reorg.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you would, yes

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you can selectively remotely shut down nodes though

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes would be terrible for exchanges and things... but only if they had open prots I think

Author: Alright#0419
Content: nope

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: how else do you force conenction to a node if it has closed ports

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: sit there waiting for it to connect you you then hit it with a reorg

Author: Alright#0419
Content: calling it a "killswitch" is more of a hyperbole, but it sure as fuck should not be there

Author: Alright#0419
Content: and it's been brought up multiple times, seems they don't care

Author: Alright#0419
Content: if you can sustain 51% on your fork for ~4.5 hours, you can essentially shut down the ZEC network. It would require human intervention to fix it seems, as you could shut it down over and over with the same fork

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it seems they don't care because 4.5 hours of 51% is a huge chunk of money, but there are surely entities that could do that.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: also don't forget that they knowingly implemented this üòâ

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's not an unintended consequence of something else. They went out of their way to make it this way

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Why tho

Author: Alright#0419
Content: https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/713 they talk about it here

Author: Alright#0419
Content: and cite mars as the reason :troll:

Author: Alright#0419
Content: `Here's another way to look at it. Suppose there's a shared blockchain between Earth and Mars, and then some cosmic event regards it impossible to communicate between the two planets. We can all tell that the cosmic event is going to last two earth years, and then normal communication will be restored. We all know that Earth has a lot more mining power than Mars. But, you live in Mars. What do you do?`

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
Who knows wh6y it is there, maybe to screw over people who fork it without knowing what they are doing? 
KMD is basically immune to this, as long as a single notarization happens within the MAX_REORG_LENGTH  it will never try to reorg more than MAX_REORG_LENGTH... this was a very recent change I made to it, that caused a few bugs at first, but seems to be working as intended now. 
komodod flat out bans anyone trying to push a chain that is older than the last ntoarized height. So it never enters this silly block of code.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yea this was fixed in KMD about a year ago

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you coul dstill do it actually I think. BUt it was pretty hard to do

Author: Alright#0419
Content: many zcash forks still have it though

Author: Alright#0419
Content: have tried to warn as many as I could find about it though

Author: Alright#0419
Content: XSG and CMM removed it, not sure who else

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @grewalsatinder ZEC price is in free fall for a few reasons. I highly recommend you don't buy any, but this is not financial advice üòÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Z11 owners are battling A9++ owners to breakeven, Z11's got delivered first, and have no A9++'s to compete with, for a few precious days, until the A9++' batch1s are delivered and begin to compete. No matter the price of ZEC, both sets of miners will aggressively sell to try to break even

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Additional fun is Binance is one of the biggest ZEC/BTC pairs and miners cannot withdraw from it right now, which will cause some weirdness/premiums for zec/btc on other exchanges

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @grewalsatinder there is no short-term gain to HODLing zec, only short term risk, as sell pressure far outweighs buy pressure, just like VBK

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ZEC/BTC 1 year chart, shows ACCELERATION of the sell-off recently

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: We might hit a bottom one day, but we haven't found it yet, and we can go much lower

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: If you really truly think that ZEC technology will be massive in the future, buying various cheaper ZEC forks has a lot more upside, since they are all way undervalued compared to ZEC
